title: Module2_concentration
text: functions form module take emission sets per TM5-FASST region year generated Module 1 (m1_emissions_rescale), estimate fine particulate matter (PM2.5) ozone (O3) concentration levels period TM5-FASST region. particular package reports following range PM2.5 O3 indicators: Fine particulate matter (PM2.5) concentration levels (m2_get_conc_pm25) Raw ozone concentration levels (m2_get_conc_o3) Maximum 6-monthly running average daily maximum hourly O3 (M6M, also known 6mDMA1) (m2_get_conc_m6m). indicator used compute health impacts attributable exposure ozone (see Jerret et al 2009) module includes two additional functions estimate crop losses associated high ozone concentration levels, suing two different mettrics described Van Dingenen et al 2009: * Accumulated daytime hourly O3 concentration threshold 40 ppbV (AOT40) (m2_get_conc_aot40) * Seasonal mean daytime O3 concentration (m2_get_conc_mi) code shows example get PM2.5 concentration levels: PM2.5 concntration region 2050 (ug/m3)  indicated documentation TM5-FASST Van Dingenen et al 2018,estimates PM2.5 O3 concentration levels receptor region driven emissions different precursors different sources based parametrizations meteorology atmospheric chemistry drawn complex TM5 model. summary, concentration pollutant \(j\), region \(y\), precursors (\(\)) emitted regions (\(x_k\)), calculated : \[C_j (y)=C_{j,base} (y)+∑_{k=1}^{n_x}∑_{=1}^{n_i}SRC_{,j} [x_k,y]\cdot[E_i (x_k)-E_{,base} (x_k )]\] \(C_{j,base} (y)\) base-run concentration level pollutant j region y, pre-computed TM5. \(E_{,base} (x_k)\) base-run precursor emissions region \(x_k\) \(SRC_{,j} [x_k,y]\) = \(\)–-\(j\) source-receptor coefficient source region \(x_k\) receptor region y, pre-computed 20% emission reduction component region \(x_k\) relative base-run \(E_i (x_k)\) emissions precursor region \(x_k\) analyzed scenario. Following equation, base-run emissions concentrations, source-receptor coefficient matrixes need combined emissions pathways analyzed scenario. package includes following input information: SO4: SO2, NOx NH3 NO3: NOx, SO2, NH3 NH4: NH3, NOx SO2 BC: BC_POP POM: POM_POP O3 exposure (O3): NOx, NMVOC SO2 health calculations: M6M (6mDMA1): NOx, NMVOC, SO2 CH4 AOT40: NOx, NMVOC, SO2 CH4 Mi (M7 M12): NOx, NMVOC, SO2 CH4 package also includes base emission concentration levels indicators. addition, primary PM2.5 emissions (BC POM) assumed direct influence urban (dense) areas, emission-concentration relation two pollutants modified using adjustment coefficients included package.
code: library(rfasst) library(magrittr)   db_path<-"path_to_your_gcam_database"  query_path<-"path_to_your_gcam_queries_file"  db_name<-"name of the database"  prj_name<-"name for a Project to add extracted results to" # (any name should work, avoid spaces just in case)   scen_name<-"name of the GCAM scenario"  queries<-"Name of the query file" # (the package includes a default query file that includes all the queries required in every function in the packae, "queries_rfasst.xml")  # saveOutput: Writes the files.By default = T  # map: Produce the maps. By default = F  #     # To write the csv files into the output folder:       m2_get_conc_pm25(db_path, query_path, db_name, prj_name,                       scen_name, queries, saveOutput = T, map = F, anim = T, recompute = F)     # To save as data frame pm2.5 concentration levels by TM5-FASST region in year 2050:       pm25.conc.2050<-dplyr::bind_rows(m2_get_conc_pm25(db_path,query_path,db_name,prj_name,scen_name,queries, saveOutput = F)) %>% dplyr::filter(year == 2050)                                 head(pm25.conc.2050)

title: Module2_concentration
text: new release rfasst (rfasst-v2.0) allows user get high-resolution (0.01 x 0.01 km) gridded concentration maps. gridded PM2.5 maps based static downscaling approach, based observed PM2.5 data Hammer et al 2020. indicated publication, dataset includes “annual concentrations (micrograms per cubic meter) composition ground-level fine particulate matter (PM2.5). data set combines”AOD retrievals multiple satellite algorithms including NASA MODerate resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer Collection 6.1 (MODIS C6.1), Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer Version 23 (MISRv23), MODIS Multi-Angle Implementation Atmospheric Correction Collection 6 (MAIAC C6), Sea-Viewing Wide Field--View Sensor (SeaWiFS) Deep Blue Version 4.” use data compute static “grid--region” coefficients saved raster file provided package (pm25_weights_rast). region-level PM2.5 concentration levels calculated (using m2_get_conc_pm25 function), obtained dataframe can rasterized 0.01 x 0.01 resolution grid map. , combine rasterized output pre-computed grid--region downscaling coefficients obtain final gridded output. downscaling procedure can activated setting parameter downscale = T. requires significantly computing time set Fby default. addition, user can write produced raster file georeferenced “tiff” file setting saveRaster_grid = T (associated increase computing time). Finally, updated tool also enables re-aggregate gridded output new resolution interest user. version, tool includes re-aggregate gridded results “NUTS3” aggregation European Commission. order get additional resolutions, user need load shape file (SpatVector object) make changes corresponding code (Lines 493-527). Future model version try make procedure user-friendly, challenge due large size shape files. re-aggregation gridded data new resolutions can activated following boolean: agg_grid = T. Likewise, re-aggregated results can written .csv file setting save_AggGrid = T. example provided code :
code: library(rfasst) library(magrittr)   db_path<-"path_to_your_gcam_database"  query_path<-"path_to_your_gcam_queries_file"  db_name<-"name of the database"  prj_name<-"name for a Project to add extracted results to" # (any name should work, avoid spaces just in case)   scen_name<-"name of the GCAM scenario"  queries<-"Name of the query file" # (the package includes a default query file that includes all the queries required in every function in the packae, "queries_rfasst.xml")    # Produce downscaled/gridded outputs and save them as a raster file.   # Also, re-aggregate the gridded output to NUTS3 resolution (and save the re-aggrgeated dataframe into a csv file)       m2_get_conc_pm25(db_path, query_path, db_name, prj_name,                       scen_name, queries, saveOutput = F, map = F, anim = T, recompute = F,                            downscale = T, saveRaster_grid = T,                            agg_grid = "NUTS3", save_AggGrid = T)

title: rfasst
text: Back Contents package consists set functions divided four different modules: - Module 1. Emissions re-scaling: Process emissions GCAM-region re-scale TM5-FASST regions, make additional pollutant-related adjustments. details Module1 emissions page. - Module 2. Concentration: Estimate fine particulate matter (PM2.5) ozone (O3) concentration levels (measured different indicators) region. details Module2 concentration page. - Module 3. Health: Report adverse health effects attributable exposure fine particulate matter (PM2.5) ozone (O3; M6M). details Module3 health page. Module 3 includes submodule calculate economics impacts associated estimated adverse health effects (ADD LINK) - Module 4. Agriculture: Estimate adverse agricultural impacts associated ozone exposure, including relative yield losses (RYLs) production revenue losses. details Module4 agriculture page. addition, package includes default input files (.Rda), read different functions. can changed user. constants include: - GCAM crop categories included analysis - Shares allocate emissions Russia Eastern (RUE) Russia Western (RUS) - Coefficients /counterfactual values exposure-response functions applied estimate adverse health agricultural impacts. - Baseline moratlity rates. - Values health impact economic assessment (e.g., Value Statistical Life) -
